data.title: Thailand greets 29 million tourists this year, earns 1.35tn baht
data.description: Tourism industry rebounds with visitors from China, Malaysia, India, South Korea and Russia leading the list; recent spike attributed to winter holidays and Diwali break

data.title: Bangkok police bust poker game, arrest 16 foreigners
data.description: 14 Chinese and 2 Taiwanese caught playing cards for money in a former restaurant after dissatisfied Thais file complaint

data.title: Separate tax for cigarettes in pipeline to combat smuggling surge
data.description: Finance Ministry aiming to plug 2.3-billion-baht gap in lost revenue

data.title: Early election takeaways: Trump weakens Democrats’ coalition
data.description: Even with the outcome uncertain Tuesday night, the 2024 presidential election already has exposed the depths of a fractured nation as the candidates navigated political shifts based on class, race and age under the near-constant threat of misinformation and violence.

data.title: Touring photographic exhibition shows HM the King at work
data.description: The Contemporary Photography Foundation of Thailand takes 109 images of the monarch from Bangkok to Nakhon Ratchasima and Hua Hin

data.title: Diesel and fresh fruit push October inflation up by 0.83%
data.description: Poonpong Naiyanapakorn, the Director General of the Trade Policy and Strategy Office, revealed that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in October 2024 was 108.61. Compared to October 2023 (107.72), the headline inflation increased by 0.83% (YoY).

data.title: Thailand, Germany launch TGC EMC project to drive toward Net Zero goals
data.description: Eight agencies have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) under the Thai-German Cooperation on Energy, Mobility and Climate (TGC EMC) to formally demonstrate their commitment to collaboration on supporting Thailand’s climate goals.

data.title: Macbook crowned Thailand’s top brand in 2024 Superfans Survey
data.description: Iconic laptop beats competition from Dettol shower gel and HP computers

data.title: Thailand’s Festival of Lights
data.description: A part of Thai culture for centuries, Loy Krathong will be celebrated on Nov 15 and is based on the lunar calendar ritual of releasing illuminated lotus-shaped floats or krathongs on rivers and waterways. It also pays homage to the water goddess, apart from being a time to reflect, express gratitude and make a wish for good fortune. Guru By Bangkok Post  lists a few places to join in the celebrations.

data.title: ‘Harmony World Puppet Innovation Festival’ gets underway next week
data.description: Puppeteers from Australia, Turkey, Mexico, Indonesia, Laos and Myanmar will join troupes from Thailand in highlighting wildlife extinction

data.title: New master’s programmes to take tech education to a new level
data.description: Kasikorn Business-Technology Group partners with three leading universities to prepare the workforce of the future

data.title: Thai businesses urged to prepare for new round of US-China trade war
data.description: With both Harris and Trump promising to raise tariffs, Thai businesses must prepare for fallout as US-China trade war intensifies

data.title: Adding two new managers for THAI rehabilitation plan is ‘necessary’
data.description: Finance Ministry dismisses concerns its decision risks politicising the national airline while setting lower price for rights offering

data.title: The detective's toolkit
data.description: Although you may have never read or watched the well-known Japanese manga, animation and movie Detective Conan, you probably have heard famous quotes from the animation such as, "there is always only one truth", or "my dad taught me when we were in Hawaii".

data.title: Harris voters driven by democracy; Trump supporters by inflation, immigration
data.description: Voters for Kamala Harris and Donald Trump who cast their ballots for Tuesday’s presidential election had vastly different motivations — reflecting a broader national divide on the problems the United States faces.

data.title: ChatGPT search: Kaspersky urges users to click links with caution
data.description: OpenAI recently introduced ChatGPT search, a new web search tool integrated into its existing interface. It is a useful feature; however, just like with traditional search, users should exercise caution when clicking on links suggested by the chatbot.

data.title: Lao People’s Revolutionary Party calls for action to address economic woes
data.description: Party Secretary General Thongloun Sisoulith (pic) has called for strong action to address the country’s economic problems, saying that these issues can no longer remain unresolved.

data.title: PLA launches latest stealth jet fighter — J-35A
data.description: The People's Liberation Army Air Force declassified its latest hardware, the J-35A stealth fighter jet, on Tuesday, saying the model will make its public debut at an upcoming airshow.

data.description: The People's Liberation Army Air Force declassified its latest hardware, the J-35A stealth fighter jet, on Tuesday, saying the model will make its public debut at an upcoming airshow.

data.title: Swing-state polls close as America chooses between Harris and Trump
data.description: A divided America weighed a stark choice for the nation’s future Tuesday as a presidential campaign marked by upheaval and rancour approached its finale.

data.title: SAC Chairman departs for China to attend high-level regional summits
data.description: The Chairman of the State Administration Council (SAC), Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, left for China this morning to participate in a series of meetings, including the Greater Mekong Subregion Summit.

data.title: MDES backs TIDC Project to boost digital innovation, advancing Thailand's economy
data.description: MDES supports the private sector in establishing the Thailand International Digital Business & Finance Centre (TIDC) Project, boosting investments in digital innovation to advance Thailand’s digital economy

data.title: King Power unveils innovative City Boutique at One Bangkok
data.description: King Power Group, Thailand’s leading luxury retailer, this week unveiled its “City Boutique” in the prestigious One Bangkok development located in the bustling heart of the capital.

data.description: Price of oil-palm fruits and crude palm oil within the country has been rising continuously

data.title: Domestic tourists up 9% YOY, but likely to miss THB1tn revenue goal
data.description: Total domestic tourists this year could exceed 200 million person-trips, TAT estimates

data.title: Lisa teaches dancing to children on TV show
data.description: Thailand’s very own K-pop princess Lalisa “Lisa” Manobal undertook a role as a dance teacher for children in a recent episode of the television series “Celebrity Substitute”. The programme featuring Lisa was broadcast on October 29.

data.title: Golden Mount glitters with annual temple fair from Friday
data.description: Bangkok landmark lights up with 10 days of cultural shows, music, games, food stalls and more
